alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 07 at 8:19PM MDT until July 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND THE WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strong and gusty west winds will develop once again Saturday afternoon while relative humidity values drop to below 15 percent in many locations, and high temperatures soar a few degrees above average with a high Haines Index of 6. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), North Central Mountains (Zone 120), and West Central Mountains (Zone 105) from noon to 8 pm MDT Saturday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with occasional gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent with the higher relative humidity values above 8500 feet. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains
